statements.name: PROC HTTP
statements.description: Invokes a web service that issues requests.

arguments.name: URL=
arguments.description: specifies the endpoint for the HTTP equest.

arguments.name: AUTH_ANY
arguments.description: specifies that any type of authentication can be used to authenticate to the connected server.

arguments.name: AUTH_BASIC
arguments.description: specifies to use user identity authentication to authenticate to the connected server.

arguments.name: AUTH_NEGOTIATE
arguments.description: specifies to use Kerberos or some other type of HTTP authentication to authenticate to the connected server.

arguments.name: AUTH_NONE
arguments.description: specifies not to use basic authentication or to negotiate authentication.

arguments.name: CLEAR_CACHE
arguments.description: specifies to clear both the shared connection and cookie caches before the HTTP request is executed.

arguments.name: CLEAR_CONN_CACHE
arguments.description: specifies to clear the shared connection cache before the HTTP request is executed.

arguments.name: CLEAR_COOKIES
arguments.description: specifies to clear the shared cookie cache before the HTTP request is executed.

arguments.name: CT=
arguments.description: specifies the HTTP content-type to be set in the request headers.

arguments.name: EXPECT_100_CONTINUE
arguments.description: enables a client to determine whether the target server is willing to accept the request.

arguments.name: FOLLOWLOC
arguments.description: enables write methods to automatically follow URL redirections.

arguments.name: HEADERIN=
arguments.description: specifies a fileref to a text file that contains one line per request header in the format key:value.

arguments.name: HEADEROUT=
arguments.description: specifies a fileref to a text file to which the response headers are written in the format key:value.

arguments.name: HEADEROUT_OVERWRITE
arguments.description: causes the response header to record only the last header block sent by the web server when a redirect occurs.

arguments.name: IN=
arguments.description: specifies the input data.

arguments.name: fileref
arguments.description: specifies a fileref. The fileref is a pointer to data that exists in another location. A fileref is assigned with the FILENAME statement.

arguments.name: “string"
arguments.description: specifies input data in a quoted string.

arguments.name: MULTI FORM
arguments.description: sends input data as a standard HTML form.

arguments.name: input
arguments.description: (required) specifies the basic content in the form. The value that you specify in "Name" populates the Name="field-name" portion of the generated content-disposition header.

arguments.name: FILENAME=
arguments.description: (optional) specifies a file name for the Filename= field of the generated content-disposition header.

arguments.name: NOFILENAME
arguments.description: (optional) specifies to omit the Filename= field from the generated content-disposition header. This option enables you to use a fileref as input that is not a file, as far as the form is concerned.

arguments.name: HeaderList
arguments.description: (optional) specifies a list of headers. Each header is in the form:

arguments.name: MULTI
arguments.description: specifies a multipart upload. Two types of multipart uploads are supported:

arguments.name: "content-descriptor"
arguments.description: specifies a user-defined value for a generated content-type header. For example, if the quoted value is “mixed”, a header of Content-Type: multipart/mixed is sent. This option indicates that the request is a generic multipart request.

arguments.name: input
arguments.description: (required) specifies the basic content in the form. The value that you specify in "Name" populates the Name="field-name" portion of the generated content-disposition header.

arguments.name: FILENAME=
arguments.description: (optional) specifies a file name for the Filename= field of the generated content-disposition header.

arguments.name: NOFILENAME
arguments.description: (optional) specifies to omit the Filename= field from the generated content-disposition header. This option enables you to use a fileref as input that is not a file, as far as the form is concerned.

arguments.name: HeaderList
arguments.description: (optional) specifies a list of headers. Each header is in the form:

arguments.name: MAXREDIRECTS=
arguments.description: specifies the maximum number of redirects that are allowed.

arguments.name: METHOD=
arguments.description: specifies an HTTP method.

arguments.name: NO_CONN_CACHE
arguments.description: disables connection caching for this procedure execution.

arguments.name: NO_COOKIES
arguments.description: specifies cached cookies will not be used for this procedure execution.

arguments.name: NOFOLLOWLOC
arguments.description: prevents the GET method from following URL redirections.

arguments.name: OAUTH_BEARER=
arguments.description: sends an OAuth access token along with the HTTP call.

arguments.name: OUT=
arguments.description: specifies a fileref where output is written.

arguments.name: PROXY_AUTH_BASIC
arguments.description: specifies to perform user identity authentication through a proxy server.

arguments.name: PROXY_AUTH_NEGOTIATE
arguments.description: specifies to perform Kerberos or some other type of HTTP authentication through a proxy server.

arguments.name: PROXYHOST=
arguments.description: specifies the internet host name of an HTTP proxy server.

arguments.name: PROXYPASSWORD=
arguments.description: specifies an HTTP proxy server password.

arguments.name: PROXYPORT=
arguments.description: specifies an HTTP proxy server port.

arguments.name: PROXYUSERNAME=
arguments.description: specifies an HTTP proxy server user name.

arguments.name: QUERY=
arguments.description: provides an alternate method for submitting query parameters for the URL= argument.

arguments.name: TIMEOUT=
arguments.description: specifies the number of seconds of inactivity to wait before canceling an HTTP request.

arguments.name: WEBPASSWORD=
arguments.description: specifies a password for basic authentication.

arguments.name: WEBUSERNAME=
arguments.description: specifies a user name for basic authentication.

statements.name: DEBUG
statements.description: Writes debugging information to the SAS log.

arguments.description: no debugging. This is the same as specifying PROC HTTP without the DEBUG statement.
displays request and response headers in the log.
displays request data as well as level 1 messages in the log.
displays response data as well as level 2 messages in the log.

arguments.name: NO_REQUEST_BODY
arguments.description: suppresses the request body from the information displayed when a debug level of 2 or greater is specified.

arguments.name: NO_REQUEST_HEADERS
arguments.description: suppresses the request header from the information displayed when a debug level of 1 or greater is specified.

arguments.name: NO_RESPONSE_BODY
arguments.description: suppresses the response body from the information displayed when a debug level of 3 is specified.

arguments.name: NO_RESPONSE_HEADERS
arguments.description: suppresses the response header from the information displayed when a debug level of 1 or greater is specified.

arguments.name: OUTPUT_TEXT
arguments.description: displays the request body and response body as if they are text.

arguments.name: REQUEST_BODY
arguments.description: displays the request body in the log.

arguments.name: REQUEST_HEADERS
arguments.description: displays the request header in the log.

arguments.name: RESPONSE_BODY
arguments.description: displays the response body in the log.

arguments.name: RESPONSE_HEADERS
arguments.description: displays the response header in the log.

statements.name: HEADERS
statements.description: Specifies request headers for the HTTP request.

arguments.name: "HeaderName"=
arguments.description: is a name and value pair that represents a header name and its value. The HeaderName can be a standard header name or a custom header name. For information about header field definitions, see the HTTP/1.1 specification at www.w3.org.

statements.name: SSLPARMS
statements.description: Sets SSL parameters for the PROC HTTP request.

arguments.name: "SSLSystemOption"=
arguments.description: specifies one or more SAS system options for encryption that enable a secure client-server connection with the target server.
